title: Are all singers songwriters or someone else writes their songs? - Quora

response.answer_text: Is it a hard and fast rule? No. It's not even a guideline.  Songwriting depends upon the person who is the creative mind behind lyrics. This is not restricted to any specific person in a band. I'll provide a few examples. In Black Sabbath, Geezer Butler (Bass) wrote the lyrics based on Tony Iommi's (Guitar) riffs, or vice versa, and handed them over to singer Ozzy Osbourne. In Lamb of God, once the instrumentals are done, the track is handed over to Randy Blythe (singer), who then writes the lyrics. These two examples would answer your question. As an added example, to imply that songwriting isn't restricted to a SINGLE person, I would quote Metallica (St. Anger onwards). While creating the St. Anger album, ALL band members contributed to the writing process, not just the singer or drummer, etc.  What I have spoken about above is just based on my knowledge of Heavy Metal music. With reference to any other genre or individual singers, they probably do write the lyrics themselves, or have writers that help them out (I think Beyoncé uses writers). Cheers.

It's not necessary that all singers write their songs it depends on one's abilities n capabilities… cause in a singers life his voice is what has to be soothing n melodious.. If he or she is able to write a song that's his or her's n put it into music then it's a great thing but if he or she may not.. it's not a thing to worry for.. N that's why we have lyricists.. For any further queries.. feel free to text me.. Instagram : @con.dolcezza

In Bollywood, it’s very very rare. I can just remember Kishore Kumar who wrote some songs that he sang. Like “Aa Chal ke tujhe main lae ke chalu…” Ravindra Jain also used to write lyrics that he sang. These days, I can quote Vishal Dadlani, who wrote one or two songs for him. Cant remember any other singers who penned their own song. There are however composers / singers who composed and sang some numbers by themselves like Hemant Kumar in the yesteryears and A R Rehaman, Vishal Dadlani of the present days. However, there are lots of western Singers who sang the song of their own lyrics. John lenon, Paul Mccartney, George Harisson and even Ringo Star, all from the Beatles penned lyrics that were sung by themselves as well. Eric Clapton, Elvis Presley, John Denver as well to name a few wrote the lyrics of many of their own songs.

The short answer is no, not all singers write their own songs. But it really depends on what genre you’re asking about. For most pop and radio-friendly music you hear, the majority of those artists do not write their own songs because there’s a formula behind it and the procuders/labels want to capitalize on that (…it’s amazing how some of this music has 6 writers for 3 lines and several producers for a song that hardly has any real instruments…ok, ok, off my soap box!). There are some exceptions, however. When you get into genres such as heavy metal, the band usual has one or two writers for their songs. Rarely will you find someone outside the band writing for them.

Nah. In fact, I think it’s fairly uncommon. Beyonce - Run the World (Girls) - 6 songwriters, 4 producers Justin Bieber - Sorry - 5 songwriters, 2 producers Record companies and stars pay a lot of good money for the songs they get to perform, so not acknowledging the other songwriters doesn’t really bother me all that much. Personally, I like how country music handles the songwriter situation. If you ever watch a country music award show, the artist will almost always thank the songwriter during their speech and sometimes the songwriter even goes up on stage. Again, not necessary, but I think it’s a nice thing to do.

Definitely not. There are definitely those who do (Sia, Lady Gaga, Taylor Swift, Ed Sheeran, Bruno Mars), but a lot of times, a singer may ask another writer to make her a song (the most popular go-to for this is Sia). If they tell Sia their vision, they might get a credit. A lot of them are simply asked to just put vocals on a song. Sometimes, the direction that they want for their music may not even be the one that they want for their career, and is dictated by their image or their label.

Certainly not. Obviously, singers, lyricists and composers are different jobs and they need quite different abilities to do well in their own work. The singers are supposed to have charming voices and be rich in emotions. And not every singer is talented at writing songs. After all, the most important thing for them is to sing well, either their own songs or others’. Of course, there are some singers who can write lyrics or composition or even both. They get inspiration from daily life and write it down to create their own songs. But this kind of crackerjack singers is unusual actually.

No, it is common to for a song to be written by someone else or a team of writers. Sometimes it’s because songwriting isn’t their thing or it’s simply because every writer is a little different and that writers song might just be the one for them and/or their representation. Another example of this is those who are cover artist or cover songs; There might be a different arrangement and/or interpretation but the original song was written by someone else.

No. It depends. When someone calls them self a singer songwriter then they probably wrote most of their content. Most of the time when the singer is at a certain level a lot of material is cowritten within a group of songwriters. Sometimes they will have the singer be apart of that session. A lot of songwriters will also write music and catalog it for singers who don’t write a lot.

Depends. Whitney Houston was a huge star and wrote very little to non. Madonna writes (or at least adds her name) to Everything. She’s worth 800 Million. The more you write the more percentages you make. Dolly Parton same. Prince. Same. Katy Perry and Pink write a lot as well.

It would be nice to think that all of them are so talented, even can create beautiful songs. In reality they have to sing according to their contract with their producers. Producers choose songs written by other authors or groups of authors. For example Eurovision song contest… and different people create music and lyrics. That's the standard nowadays.

No singer writes his song sololy, there are always some co-writers in the background.although there also some singers who writes their songs as well as for other singers ,here i would like to mention 'Ed Sheeran' who is my faviorite and writes his songs but also writes songs for other artists too as he wrote 'love yourself'(justin bieber) which was originally written for his 'divide' album. So i think u got an answer for your question . T.Y

Actually no. We presume that if a song is sung by an artist it may also have been written by the same artist. But it doesn't happen always.Singers often work with lyricists or may even do a collab. For instance, the popular song ‘ Diamonds' by Rihanna was actually written by Sia and ‘Pretty hurts' by Beyonce was also written by Sia furler.

Only the intelligent ones, the “recording artists “ are mere Puppets of the Industry… Many have a team of writers… The true artists write and perform their own material… As Bob Dylan once said : “ all you need for a good song is Three Chords and the Truth “

No. Some writers don’t sing and singers don’t write. However if you can sing then you would have probably written something at some point. In my opinion if you can call yourself a singer then you can sing. Which means practice. Experience. Dedication and hours of work so writing is part of that. So yes you should write your own songs.

Absolutely not, some singers are not great at writing but singing… they are pros, so they get people that are talented in that department to assist them, so does songwriters some cannot sing to save their lives so they get talented singers to be the voice of their poetry… But some have the best of the both worlds, they can sing and write.

In pop & hip hop, 99% pf the music is created by the producer with the singer contributing to the lyrics. In Rock, the artists tend to do it all. Specifically, when the artists are bands. Foo Fighters, Metallica, Stone Sour all write all their music & lyrics.

In India I don't think so, but it's very common in US and UK , people mostly write and compose their songs by themselves ( or Collab with other artists). It really promotes creativity and new talents whereas in India it's all about bollywood and the business that comes with it people rarely support local music scenes mostly they go for brands - best singer - best composer - best writer . It's really hard for an outsider artist to break into this country's music scene.

Hello there. If all singers write their own songs, there will not be any jobs for composers or songwriters. Even if it is great to know that your favourite singer created his songs by himself, some have to depend on others to do so. An example would be Justin Bieber’s “Lose Yourself” which was written by the artist himself with the help of Ed Sheeran and Benny Blanco. So, the answer to your question would be no.
No, not all singers write their own songs… songs can even be written by someone who is not a singer than that person decides to sell the song to the singer

No.All singers don't write their own songs.Some of them sing the songs they are offered to and some prefer writing their own.It’s their very own choice whether to write a song or sing the offered or both.
No, not all singers write their songs. Even the ones who claim they do, often rely on other people to write songs for them.
Definitely no. Some Singers prefer to write their own songs just like Taylor swift but most singers just have someone write a song for them

No. Most of the singers do not write their own songs. In bollywood, their are lyricist who provide words to the songs. However their are quite a few singers who write as well as compose their own songs such as Darshan Raval, Honey Singh, Guru Randhawa, Himesh Reshamiya.

No. But there are a few singers who have written their own songs. There's a song in Chennai express called “tera rasta chhodun na” which is sung by Amitabh bhattacharya and anusha mani. It's also written by Amitabh bhattacharya.
short answer, no… and most things we hear on the radio were written by people NOT singing, some written by teams of people

Some do, but some don't. Some singers and corporations pay songwriters to write songs. Other singers write their songs themselves, sometimes with the help or assistance of one or more people. Usually close friends, family, or other musicians.
No some of them say they do and do a parody of another, and some actually do wright their own songs you just have to listen to the beat. It works sometimes and others its hard to tell.
No. Some do, but many modern “artists” perform music that was written by someone else.

NO thats not true some people are able t write their own songs but some people only have their voice not their minds and example is that of that BEBE REXHA was the one who wrote MONSTER song sang by RIHANNA AND EMINEM

Most singers write their own songs. But you will find some songs that were written by someone else that they also sing. In the credits of most movies when they say what music and/or songs featured there you will notice that they say who wrote it and who sang it.
No most of the pop songs are writen by a writer. Now then a lot of rock, metal, rap, do write there songs.
Not all singers write their own songs all the time. Sometimes fellow artists give songs to another. For example, the song Manic Monday was given to The Bangles by Prince.
No, think of how many cover songs there are, plus there are professional writers who write for many famous singers.
some singers write only their songs. Their are some song writers that don’t sing they write for many other singers.
No some singers do not write their own music some people including my self don't have the talent to write music but can sing others just chose not to write their own music
No. Some singers pay others to write songs for them or they get aongs from copyright writers.
Not all singers do but it would be so admirable if a singer could do both singing and writing their own song.
No some singers wrote our songs on our behalf but mostly singers only sing the song .
No not all of them write ther own songs. Some singers by the lyrics from other singers how write their own songs
Nope. Some singer have a good voice but can compose any song that’s why Ed Sheeran make a son and sell it
No many of the most famous singers are helping writing the song but they have often a song writer and producer who does the most of the work
No, there are a great many singers who do not write their own songs. Though, it is more common that they do or collaborate with several others in the process.
No…! Singer just use his voice not his heart r his feeling.. All are hidden in the heart of writer.
it depends how creative you are. as you can see singing and being good with words is quite different. Not every lyricist is a singer so how can you expect a singer to be lyricist all the time.
No, some people write their songs for them.
many of them do it themselves and others are written by other people
No, not ALL of them, but many do.
No, they don’t all write their own songs.
No but all singers make songs their own.
No some singers copy some old song and edit some words in that song.
Some do but it is shown that about %70 of the singers do write their own song's
No most singers infact do not write music and buy the services of a song writer.
No because a person can sing a cover song
no most don’t they all have songwriters
Cliff Richard didn't write many of his own songs and he has had more hit singles than anyone else
No there are very few singers who write their own songs.
No some do covers of other singer's songs
No , only some of the singers have that talent
Of course not ALL of them!
No most of them have songwriters
No. Many do, though not all.
No. But the great ones do.
Not all but most do yes
No ADELE has a team of 5 songwriters
